intro: Argyrolobium friesianum, commonly known as the Friesian silverlobelia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is known for its leguminous characteristics. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
